manually. Parent is allowed to be a prefix of a UIDP of a Group within
scope, or the name of a Group in scope.

claimMatch.description:
claim_match checks the third party IdP token's claims against one
or more configured patterns.

name.description: name, human readable name of identity.

servicePrincipal.description:
service_principal is the name of the Chainguard service that is
allowed to assume this identity.  These names correlate with the
service names used in impersonation with account associations.

static.description:
static is equivalent to literal, but instead of discovering the
IdP's verification keys we verify the identity using pre-registered
verification keys.  This is intended for use with identities from
providers without an "online" issuer (network accessible to our IdP),
such as a KinD/minikube cluster.
NOTE: because this path does not have a mechanism for key rotation
the identity will expire, with a maximum lifetime of 30d.

createdAt.description: created_at is the timestamp for when the policy was created.

enforcedVersion.description:
enforced_version contains information about the enforced version of this policy.
When used as a return value, Policy.name, Policy.description, and Policy.document are all copies of
the respective fields in enforced_version for backwards compatibility. enforced_version may be empty for
legacy policies without versions.
When used for Create or Update, set enforced_version.label to set an optional version label.

This field is populated from the document and any existing value will be ignored for Create/Update.

activity.description:
activity is a mapping from "Source" URLs to an activity record summarizing
recent activity from this source.

affinity.description:
affinity specifies a scheduling preference for where to run the managed agent.
Other factors, such as the provider may be taken into account when choosing a
host cluster.

agentVersion.description: agent_version holds the version of the Chainguard agent last reported by the cluster.

authInfo.description: auth_info holds authentication details for connecting to KinD in test scenarios.

description.description: a short description of this cluster.

enforcerOptions.title:
EnforcerOptions contains additional Enforcer configuration settings.
+optional

hostCluster.description:
host_cluster surfaces the opaque identifier for the Chainguard cluster hosting
this agent.

info.description: info contains the cluster information from the kubeconfig context.

issuer.description: issuer is the identity issuer tied to this cluster.

lastSeen.description: last_seen tracks the timestamp at which this cluster was last seen.

managedName.description:
managed_name is the unique name we have given to this cluster's managed agent.
This field is output-only, and is populated only when this cluster is "managed".

name.description: name of the cluster.

profiles.description:
profiles specifies the root set of tenant configurations that we want to run
on this cluster.

provider.description:
provider holds the flavor of cluster provider, which is used to determine how we
authenticate with the cluster.

registered.description: registered tracks the timestamp at which this cluster was registered.

remoteId.description: remote_id is the remote ID of this cluster.

status.description: status contains the managed cluster's status.

version.description: version holds the Kubernetes version last reported by the cluster.

parameters.description: parent_id, The Group under which this Cluster resides.
parameters.name: parentId

parameters.description: Cluster is the definition of the managed cluster to create.
parameters.name: cluster

parameters.description: id is the exact UID of the record.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: ancestors_of are groups reachable by repeated proceeding from child to parent.
parameters.name: uidp.ancestorsOf

parameters.description: descendants_of are groups reachable by repeated proceeding from parent to child.
parameters.name: uidp.descendantsOf

parameters.description: children_of are groups reachable by directly proceeding from parent to children.
parameters.name: uidp.childrenOf

serviceBindings.title:
service_bindings map from the Chainguard service principal to the
UIDP of the identity that service should assume. Constraints:
- The identity must live directly under "group",
- The identity must be a service_principal,
- The service_principal of the identity must match the key of this map.
Note that the key space of this must match the ServicePrincipal enum,
but the enum type itself cannot be used here because of:
https://groups.google.com/g/protobuf/c/ikeldBe60eI

host.description: GitHub hostname app is associated with. Output only.

installationId.description: GitHub App Installation ID. Takes precedence over name.

name.description: GitHub user/org name the installation is installed on.

ClusterAuthInfo.description:
This is based off of k8s.io/client-go/tools/clientcmd/api/v1.AuthInfo
This should only ever be used with KinD clusters during testing, it WILL
NOT be stored securely.

clientCertificateData.description: client_certificate_data contains PEM-encoded data from a client cert file for TLS.

clientKeyData.description: client_key_data contains PEM-encoded data from a client key file for TLS.

eligible.description:
eligible clusters are able to be directly enrolled as
agentless tenants immediately.  This message contains
all of the information needed to enroll this cluster.

enrolled.description:
enrolled clusters are clusters that have already been
enrolled as agentless tenants.

needsWork.description:
needs_work clusters can be modified in some way so
that they are supported by our Agentless infrastructure.

unsupported.description:
unsupported clusters cannot be enrolled with our
Agentless cluster support.

CertificateAuthorityData.title:
CertificateAuthorityData contains PEM-encoded certificate authority certificates.
Overrides CertificateAuthority

server.description: Server is the address of the kubernetes cluster (https://hostname:port).

ClusterInfo.title:
This is based off of k8s.io/client-go/tools/clientcmd/api/v1.Cluster
This can be extracted from kubectl for a named cluster (replace CLUSTER_NAME) with:
  kubectl config view \
    --flatten -o jsonpath='{.clusters[?(@.name == "CLUSTER_NAME")].cluster}'

ClusterProvider.description:
- CLOUD_RUN: GCP Services (10+)
 - ECS: AWS Services (20+)
 - KIND: For testing.

arn.title: Exact match to Arn of AWS Identity

awsAccount.title:
Required, matches the `Account` field in the GetCallerID AWS IAM
response

userId.title: Exacty match of the UserID field

audience.description: audience of OIDC ID tokens issued for this identity.

audiencePattern.description:
audience_pattern is a regular expression for matching the
token's audience claim.

claimPatterns.description:
claim_patterns is a mapping from the name of a custom claim
to a regular expression for matching that claim's value.

claims.description:
claims is a mapping from the name of a custom claim
to a literal matching that claim's value.

issuer.description: issuer of the OIDC ID tokens issued for this identity.

issuerPattern.description:
issuer_pattern is a regular expression for matching the
token's issuer claim.

subject.description: subject of OIDC ID tokens issued for this identity.

subjectPattern.description:
subject_pattern is a regular expression for matching the
token's subject claim.

additionalScopes.title: Additional scopes to request for ID tokens

expiration.description:
expiration is the time when the issuer_keys will expire.
Defaults to / Maximum of 30 days after creation time.

issuer.description:
issuer of the OIDC ID tokens issued for this identity.
Matches the `iss` claim.

issuerKeys.description:
issuer_keys is JWKS-formatted public keys for the issuer.
Required, otherwise use Literal.

subject.description:
subject of OIDC ID tokens issued for this identity.
Matches the `sub` claim.

to.description: Target artifact that may be able to resolve this Risk.

id.description: id is the UIDP of the tenant Cluster.

profiles.description:
profiles contains the set of profiles that this
cluster was enrolled with.

steps.description:
steps holds the set of changes the user needs to make in order
for the cluster to become eligible.

reason.description: reason holds the reason the cluster is not currently supported.

type.title: What kind of data is missing (e.g. signature, sbom, policy, etc.)

id.description: id, the UID of this role binding.

identity.description: identity, UID of the Identity bound.

name.description: name contains the vendor name of the scanner.

version.description: version holds the version of the used scanner to generate the report.

score.description: CVSS score is on a scale of 0 - 10 where 0 indicates low severity and 10 indicates high severity.

version.description: CVSS version used to populate score and severity.

clusterDescription.description:
cluster_description is an optional description to give the cluster
when one is registered as part of the registration flow.

clusterId.description:
cluster_id is an optional cluster id, which simultaneously registers
a Cluster with the Identity.  This path must specify an invite code, so
we know where in the IAM hierarchy to link the cluster.

clusterName.description:
cluster_name is an optional name to give the cluster when one is
registered as part of the registration flow.

code.title:
code is an optional encoded invite code, which allows us to register
the caller's identity as a member of a particular group as a particular
role.
+optional

identityId.title:
identity_id is an optional identity id. If the user already exists, this
by-passes identity registration and continues on to cluster registration
(if applicable)

group.description:
group, the group this identity has joined by invitation, when an invite
code was supplied.

audience.description: Audience is who the token is intended for.

capabilities.description: The capabilities referenced in the token.

email.description: The upstream email for this token.

issuer.description: Issuer is the issuer of the token.

ancestorsOf.description: ancestors_of are groups reachable by repeated proceeding from child to parent.

childrenOf.description: children_of are groups reachable by directly proceeding from parent to children.

descendantsOf.description: descendants_of are groups reachable by repeated proceeding from parent to child.

expiration.description:
Expiration of identity / issuer keys. After this date /time the issuer
keys will not be trusted. Defaults / maximum of 30 days after creation
time.

id.description: id is unique identifier of this specific identity.

issuer.description:
issuer of the OIDC ID tokens issued for this identity. Matches the `iss`
claim.

issuerKeys.description:
Optional JWKS formatted public keys for the issuer. If supplied
verification of ID tokens is attempted using these keys instead of the
normal OIDC discovery path. This enables e.g clusters behing NAT to
authenticate.

subject.description:
subject of OIDC ID tokens issued for this identity. Matchs the `sub`
claim.

name.description: Output only. This is the name of the user.

updatesOptIn.description: Whether the user has opted to receive updates from Chainguard.

id.description: id is identifier of this specific subscription.

sink.description: sink is the address to which events shall be delivered using the selected protocol.

amazon.description: amazon holds information associating an Amazon account with the group.

description.description: a short description of this association.

github.description:
github holds information associating a GitHub installation with the group.
Note: this AccountAssociation type is EXPERIMENTAL.

google.description: google holds information associating a Google project with the group.

group.description: group is the group with which this account information is associated.

name.description: name of the association.

googleCa.title: google_ca is the Google Certificate Authority service

kmsCa.title: kmsca is a KMS-based CA that requires a root cert and KMS signing key

ref.title:
ref is a unique reference to the Google CA service in the format
projects/<project>/locations/<location>/<name>

id.description: id, The group UIDP under which this group resides.

name.description: name, human readable name of group.

code.description: code is the json-encoded authentication code.

expiration.description: expiration, timestamp this invite becomes no longer valid.

id.description: id, The group UIDP under which this invite resides.

keyId.description: key_id is used to identify the verification key for this code.

role.description: role is the role the invited identity will be role-bound to the group with.

awsIdentity.title: aws_identity matches AWS IAM users and roles to an identity

claimMatch.description:
claim_match checks the third party IdP token's claims against one
or more configured patterns.

id.description: id is unique identifier of this specific identity.

name.description: name, human readable name of identity.

servicePrincipal.description:
service_principal is the name of the Chainguard service that is
allowed to assume this identity.  These names correlate with the
service names used in impersonation with account associations.

static.description:
static is equivalent to literal, but instead of discovering the
IdP's verification keys we verify the identity using pre-registered
verification keys.  This is intended for use with identities from
providers without an "online" issuer (network accessible to our IdP),
such as a KinD/minikube cluster.
NOTE: because this path does not have a mechanism for key rotation
the identity will expire, with a maximum lifetime of 30d.

id.title: id is unique identifier of this specific identity provider

certChain.title:
cert_chain is the root certificate and (optional) chain
in PEM-encoded format

keyRef.title:
key_ref is a unique reference to the signing key used for this CA
most likely a KMS key prefixed with gcpkms://, awskms://, azurekms:// etc
and the relevant resource name

createdAt.description: created_at is the timestamp for when the policy was created.

description.description: description, human readable description of policy.

enforcedVersion.description:
enforced_version contains information about the enforced version of this policy.
When used as a return value, Policy.name, Policy.description, and Policy.document are all copies of
the respective fields in enforced_version for backwards compatibility. enforced_version may be empty for
legacy policies without versions.
When used for Create or Update, set enforced_version.label to set an optional version label.

id.description: id is the identifier of this specific repository.

name.description: name is the human-readable name of the repository.

deprecated.description: deprecated, true if the tag is deprecated.

digest.description: digest, the digest of the manifest with this tag.

id.description: id, identifier of this Tag, a UIDP under a Repo.

lastUpdated.description: last time this tag was updated.

name.description: name, the unique name of the Tag.

activity.description:
activity is a mapping from "Source" URLs to an activity record summarizing
recent activity from this source.

affinity.description:
affinity specifies a scheduling preference for where to run the managed agent.
Other factors, such as the provider may be taken into account when choosing a
host cluster.

agentVersion.description: agent_version holds the version of the Chainguard agent last reported by the cluster.

authInfo.description: auth_info holds authentication details for connecting to KinD in test scenarios.

description.description: a short description of this cluster.

enforcerOptions.title:
EnforcerOptions contains additional Enforcer configuration settings.
+optional

hostCluster.description:
host_cluster surfaces the opaque identifier for the Chainguard cluster hosting
this agent.

id.description: id, The Cluster UIDP under which this Cluster resides.

info.description: info contains the cluster information from the kubeconfig context.

issuer.description: issuer is the identity issuer tied to this cluster.

lastSeen.description: last_seen tracks the timestamp at which this cluster was last seen.

managedName.description:
managed_name is the unique name we have given to this cluster's managed agent.
This field is output-only, and is populated only when this cluster is "managed".

name.description: name of the cluster.

profiles.description:
profiles specifies the root set of tenant configurations that we want to run
on this cluster.

provider.description:
provider holds the flavor of cluster provider, which is used to determine how we
authenticate with the cluster.

registered.description: registered tracks the timestamp at which this cluster was registered.

remoteId.description: remote_id is the remote ID of this cluster.

status.description: status contains the managed cluster's status.

version.description: version holds the Kubernetes version last reported by the cluster.

controllerName.description:
controller_name is the name of the Controller CRD which was the source of this
activity on the tenant cluster.

lastSeen.description: last_seen tracks the timestamp at which this source was last active.

namespace.description: namespace is the namespace in which the source of this cluster activity lives.

profile.description: profile is the Chainguard profile to which the source of this activity belongs.

specHash.description:
spec_hash is the hash of the Controller or Webhook CRD's spec, which forms a
loose form of versioning.

webhookName.description:
webhook_name is the name of the Webhook CRD which was the source of this
activity on the tenant cluster.

cidrBlocks.description: cidr_blocks specifies the cidr blocks enforce uses to communicate with clusters.

profiles.title:
profiles includes the full set of profiles returned (including transitive
dependencies of the input profiles)

id.description: id is the exact UIDP of the group to impersonate to search for clusters.

profiles.description:
profiles includes the set of profiles to perform discovery for,
which may impact eligibility (some profiles may not be supported
on some providers).

providers.description: providers is the list of providers to perform discovery on.

states.description:
states is a collection of the states to return, or all if
none are specified.

state.description: state reflects the state of the fix, e.g. fixed, unknown, not-fixed, won't-fix.

versions.description: List of in versions of the package on which the vulnerability has been solved.

description.description: Output only. Free form text describing how this can be resolved.

documentationUrl.description: Output only. Chainguard EDU link for more details on this Recommendation.

cluster.description: cluster identifies the specific cluster for the record.

id.title: id holds the UIDP for this image's record

image.description: image is the container image for the record.

lastRefreshed.description:
last_refreshed will hold a PredicateType => Last time it was successfully
refreshed.

lastSeen.description: last_seen is the last time we've seen this image anywhere on this cluster.

status.description:
status is a map from analysis type (e.g. "sbom", "vuln") => RecordStatus to indidate success/failure,
the analysis timestamp, as well as any diagnostic message in case of failures.

description.description: Output only. Free form text describing this Risk.

details.description: What kind of risk is this? Lack of signatures, vulnerability, SBOM quality, etc.

documentationUrl.description: Output only. Chainguard EDU link for more details on this Risk.

groupId.description:
Grouping identifier to associate Risks in the same UIDP
to each other.

inputs.description: List of UIDPs that were used to determine this Risk.

lastSeen.description: Output only. When Enforce last saw this Risk.

recommendations.description: Optional. Chainguard's recommendation(s) for how to resolve this Risk.

tenantSbom2.description:
Sbom represents a normalized SBOM that we have ingested into our datastore.
They are linked to Signatures via ID, as in they are 'children' of Signatures
There can be multiple of these that we keep.

authors.description: authors is zero or more authors concatenated.

format.description: format holds whether the SBOM is SPDX, CycloneDX, or other.

generatedAt.description: generated_at holds when the SBOM was generated.

id.description: id, The Sbom UIDP at which this Sbom resides in the hierarchy.

lastSeen.title:
last_seen tracks the timestamp at which this sbom was last seen.
TODO(vaikas): Does this really make any sense?

name.description: Name of the Sbom.

rawSbom.description:
raw_sbom may or may not be useful in the long term, but for now to make
progress on this, we'll just yolo and serialize it here.

source.description:
source is where the SBOM came from. For example, we want to know if sbom
was generated by us, or ingested.

tool.description: tool holds the name of the tool that produced the SBOM.

id.description: id, The VulnReport UIDP at which this VulnReport resides.

lastSeen.description: last_seen tracks the timestamp at which this vuln report was last seen.

rawVulnReport.description:
raw_vuln_report may or may not be useful in the long term, but for now to make
progress on this, we'll just yolo and serialize it here.

reportGeneration.description: report_generation tracks the timestamp at which this report was generated.

scanner.description: scanner contains some information about the scanner used to generate the report.

vulnerabilityDbLastBuildTime.description: vulnerability_db_last_build_time holds the time when the vulnerability database was built last time.

fix.description: Fix related data about this vulnerability.

vulnerability.description: Vulnerability holds information about the found vulnerability.

cpeUri.description: List of cpe_uri on which the vulnerability was found.

cvss.description: List of cvss information about the exploitability of the vulnerability.

description.description: a short description of this vulnerability.

id.description: id of the vulnerability e.g. CVE_1231-12.

severity.title: severity is the value representing the severity of the vulnerability

source.description: source from where the vulnerability information was obtained, e.g. nvd, github, osv.
